授業目的: This course is designed to help students learn about and develop their practical, academic and other writing skills in English. Students will be encouraged to take ownership of language learning as a life-long process through various forms of engagement in writing tasks in and outside the classroom. Writing activities will aim at improving students’ cultural and intercultural knowledge and awareness. In addition, students will learn to approach their ideas from a global perspective, including thinking about issues critically. To achieve the overall purpose of the course, the main focus will be on learning about and developing students’ understanding of and ability to engage with the writing process. The course aims to improve writing skills that assist students with organizing their ideas and writing, including supporting, comparing, and summarizing information. Students will complete writing assignments and be given opportunities to self-edit, as well as editing others' work through collaboration. One of the main writing assignments in semester two will be to write a formal letter.
到達目標:
• To improve students’ understanding of and engagement with the writing process in English, including: Prewriting, Writing, and Revising.
• To improve students’ abilities to develop and organize written ideas.
• To improve students’ knowledge of and ability to use various types of grammar in writing.
• To develop students’ understanding of the various components of writing, including topic, supporting, and concluding sentences.
• To develop students’ understanding of and ability to reproduce a variety of writing types such as describing, comparing and contrasting, analyzing information, and expressing opinions.
• To develop students’ knoledge of and ability to write a formal letter for a variety of purposes.
• To encourage students to take ownership of English as a life-long process by developing writing skills for practical, academic, and professional purposes.
• To improve students’ cultural and intercultural understanding, awareness, and collaboration skills through cooperative learning and completing various writing activities, including a “Writing Journal.”
• To encourage a comfortable classroom atmosphere that promotes cooperation.
• To improve students’ abilities to critically engage with a variety of contemporary and global topics by encouraging exploration and reflection through in and out of class activities and writing tasks.
授業方法:
Both simultaneous + two-way and on-demand classes will be conducted to begin the semester. (If the current situation changes, this may change.)
We will use Google Classroom and email for this course and communication.
